0.user_question: Gene is sewing a quilt out of old souvenir t-shirts. He has one shirt from each vacation he has been on. Every shirt is its own quilt block. Each row is made of blocks from a different year of vacations. He goes on 7821771 vacations a year and has been vacationing since he was 23 years old. He is now 34. How many quilt blocks does he have in total?

ost_step.1: Gene has gone on vacations every year since age 23.
ost_step.2: He has been vacationing for 34 - 23 = 11 years.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Gene started going on vacations when he was 23 years old. By the time he was 34, he had been going on vacations for 11 years. During those years, he went on 7821771 vacations each year. That's 11 * 7821771 = 8603941 quilt blocks. The answer is: 8603941.

1.subquestion: How many rows of quilt blocks are there in total?

subanswer.text: There are 34 - 23 = 11 full years plus some partial years that Gene has been collecting shirts. Since each row consists of one block from each year, the number of rows is equal to the number of years, which is 11. The answer is 11.
